newsitem.title: FRANCE: Algeria names new chief of energy firm Sonatrach.
newsitem.headline: Algeria names new chief of energy firm Sonatrach.

text.p: Algeria named on Sunday exploration expert Abdelmajid Attar as the new head of state-owned company oil and gas Sonatrach, an official statement said.
Attar, a 51-year-old geologist, replaces Nazim Charef-Eddine Zouioueche.
Attar was previously Sonatrach's exploration department chief and director of its international affairs section.
The official statement, reported by the official Algerian news agency APS, said Energy and Mining Minister Youssef Housfi had appointed Attar in place of Zouioueche, but gave no further details.
Sonatrach controls Algeria's oil and gas sector which provides the North African country with more than 90 percent of its total exports.
The value of its oil and gas exports rose to $12.6 billion in 1996, up 29 percent from the previous year thanks to improved efficiency and higher international crude oil prices.
Algeria plans to raise annual earnings from oil and gas to about $16 billion by the year 2000 due mainly to increased gas exports.
